text: Kahnuj County (Persian: شهرستان کهنوج) is a county in Kerman Province in Iran. The capital of the county is Kahnuj.Gitashenasi Province Atlas of Iran اطلس گیتاشناسی استان‌های ایران At the 2006 census, the county's population (including portions later split off to form Faryab County) was 102,269, in 21,780 families; excluding those portions, the population was 70,664, in 15,029 families. The county has one district (bakhsh): the Central District. The county has one city: Kahnuj. The local language of Kahnuj is a dialect of Jirofti. Jirofti and Kahnuji belong to the Garmsiri group, which is a continuum of closely related dialects extending from the Halilrud river valley in the north down to the Strait of Hormuz in the south.Habib Borjian, “KERMAN xvi. LANGUAGES,” Encyclopædia Iranica, XVI/3, pp. 301-315, available online at http://www.iranicaonline.org/articles/kerman-16-languages ==References== Category:Counties of Kerman Province
title: Kahnuj County
